an7.24:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you seven principles that ensure you don’t decline.
an7.24:4.3: And what are the seven principles that ensure you don’t decline?
an7.24:5.1: As long as the mendicants don’t relish work, loving it and liking to relish it,
an7.24:5.2: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.24:6.1: As long as they don’t enjoy talk …
an7.24:6.4: they don’t have bad desires, falling under the sway of bad desires …
an7.24:6.5: they don’t have bad friends, companions, and associates …
an7.24:6.6: they don’t stop half-way after achieving some trifling distinction,
an7.24:6.7: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.24:7.1: As long as these seven principles that ensure you don’t decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them,
an7.24:7.2: they can expect growth, not decline.”
